packagegui.name: squidreversegeneral
packagegui.title: Reverse Proxy Server: General

field.description:
The interface(s) the reverse-proxy server will bind to (usually WAN).
Use CTRL + click to select multiple interfaces.

Important:
 To use Squid as a reverse proxy ONLY: After saving configuration here, you must tick the 'Enable Squid Proxy' checkbox under Services - Squid Proxy Server - General and click Save there.
To disable the reverse proxy ONLY (without disabling Squid completely): Unselect all 'Reverse Proxy Interface(s)', uncheck both 'Enable HTTP Reverse Proxy' and 'Enable HTTPS Reverse Proxy' below and click Save.

Squid will additionally bind to these user-defined IPs for reverse proxy operation. Useful for virtual IPs such as CARP.
Note: Separate entries by semi-colons (;)

Important: Any entry here must be a valid, locally configured IP address.
The external fully qualified domain name of the WAN IP address.

field.fielddescr: Reset TCP Connections on Unauthorized Requests
field.description: If checked, the reverse proxy will reset the TCP connection if the request is unauthorized.

If checked, the proxy server will act in HTTP reverse mode.
Important: You must add a proper firewall rule with destination matching the 'Reverse Proxy Interface(s)' address.

This is the port the HTTP reverse proxy will listen on.
Default: 80

This is the HTTP reverse proxy default site.
Note: Leave empty to use 'External FQDN' value specified above.

If checked, the proxy server will act in HTTPS reverse mode.
Important: You must add a proper firewall rule with destination matching the 'Reverse Proxy Interface(s)' address.

This is the port the HTTPS reverse proxy will listen on.
Default: 443

This is the HTTPS reverse proxy default site.
Note: Leave empty to use 'External FQDN' value specified in 'Squid Reverse Proxy General Settings'.
Choose the SSL Server Certificate here.
Paste a signed certificate in X.509 PEM format here.
If checked, internal certificate validation will be ignored.
If checked, clients need a client certificate to authenticate.
Choose the CA used to issue client authentication certificates.

Choose the CRL used for client certificates revocation. If set to 'none', no CRL validation will be performed.
Note: This must match the 'Client Certificate CA' selected above!

Important: After updating the CRL in System - Cert Manager - Certificate Revocation, remember to press the 'Refresh CRL' button below.
Otherwise, the updated CRL will not have any effect on Squid reverse proxy users!
If checked, Squid will act as an accelerator/SSL offloader for Outlook Web App.

These are the internal IPs of the CAS-Array (OWA frontend servers).
Note: Separate entries by semi-colons (;)
If checked, ActiveSync will be enabled.
If checked, RPC over HTTP will be enabled.

If checked, MAPI over HTTP will be enabled.
This feature is only available with at least Microsoft Exchange 2013 SP1

If checked, Exchange WebServices will be enabled.
There are potential DoS side effects to its use. Please avoid unless really required.

If checked, AutoDiscover will be enabled.
You also should set up the autodiscover DNS record to point to you WAN IP.
